movies.title: Sitting Bull at the Spirit Lake Massacre

biography.bio: Bryant Washburn was born on April 28, 1889 in Chicago, Illinois, USA as Franklin Bryant Washburn III. He was an actor and producer, known for The Wizard of Oz (1925), Hungry Hearts (1922) and Sitting Bull at the Spirit Lake Massacre (1927). He was married to Virginia Vance and Mabel Forrest. He died on April 30, 1963 in Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Bryant Washburn

biography.bio: A member of the Yakima tribe in Washington state, Chief Yowlachie (whose real name was Daniel Simmons) began his show-business career as--believe it or not--an opera singer and spent many years in that profession. In the 1920s he switched to films, and over the next 25 or so years played everything from rampaging Apache chiefs to comic-relief sidekicks. A large, round-faced man, his distinctive voice--a deep, resonant bass somewhat resembling Bluto's in the old "Popeye" cartoons--was instantly recognizable, and he had the distinction of not appearing to have aged much over his career, which is most likely attributable to the fact that he looked quite a bit younger than he actually was, so his "aging" wasn't all that noticeable. In addition to his "serious" roles, he had somewhat more light-hearted parts in several films, notably Red River (1948), where he traded quips with veteran scene-stealer Walter Brennan, and held his own quite well.
biography.name: Chief Yowlachie

biography.bio: Anne Schaefer was born on July 10, 1870 in St. Louis, Missouri, USA. She was an actress, known for Johanna Enlists (1918), The Little Princess (1917) and Her Spoiled Boy (1912). She was married to F. Medek. She died on May 3, 1957 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Anne Schaefer

biography.bio: Jay Morley was born on July 14, 1890 in Port Orange, Florida, USA. He was an actor, known for The Busher (1919), Two News Items (1916) and The Roads We Take (1920). He died on November 9, 1976 in Santa Monica, California, USA.
biography.name: Jay Morley

biography.bio: Shirley Palmer was born on December 25, 1908 in Chicago, Illinois, USA. She was an actress, known for Somewhere in Sonora (1933), A Bankrupt Honeymoon (1926) and Eagle of the Night (1928). She was married to John Collier. She died on March 29, 2000 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Shirley Palmer

biography.bio: James O'Neill was born on July 21, 1863 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA. He was an actor, known for The Million Dollar Robbery (1914), The Lure (1914) and Miss Arizona (1919). He died on October 8, 1938 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: James O'Neill

biography.bio: Started working with his father on stage when he was two. Later he toured in a comedy act for Fanchon and Marco. His first screen experience was at age 14, in a Pathe production of "Adventures of Bill and Bob".
biography.name: Bob Steele

biography.bio: Fred Warren and his wife Effie Conley-Warren were a Vaudeville singing and dancing team around the turn of the century. Fred Warren was the brother-in-law to Maxwell Karger who was one of the founders and the general manager of Metro Pictures before Metro became MGM. Fred Warren enjoyed an illustrious career making numerous films in Hollywood. Fred and Effie Warren made West Hollywood their home 1916 to 1940 and allowed their friend Rudolph Valentino to be married in their backyard. Fred spent many hours playing piano at Barney's Beanery.
biography.name: Fred Warren

biography.bio: Leon De La Mothe was born on December 26, 1880 in New Orleans, Louisiana, USA. He was a director and actor, known for Buck Simmons, Puncher (1916), The Quarter Breed (1916) and Blind Fury (1916). He died on June 12, 1943 in Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Leon De La Mothe

biography.bio: Lucille Ballart is an actress, known for Sitting Bull at the Spirit Lake Massacre (1927).
biography.name: Lucille Ballart

biography.bio: Thomas G. Lingham was born on April 7, 1874 in Indianapolis, Indiana, USA. He was an actor, known for The Star Packer (1934), The Amazing Vagabond (1929) and The Bandit's Son (1927). He was married to Katherine Goodrich. He died on February 19, 1950 in Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Thomas G. Lingham
